Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman scored 126 not out off 81 balls, hitting 8 fours and 11 sixes.
Babar Azam scored 66 not out off 63 balls, hitting 6 fours and 2 sixes.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by 21 runs using the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method, keeping its hopes alive for the World Cup semifinals.
Fakhar Zaman's innings was crucial for Pakistan as it helped them stay in contention despite the rain-interrupted game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain stopped play with 21.3 overs bowled, leading to a DLS finish.
New Zealand recorded the highest total at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium with 401 for six.
